text: the pharmaceutical manufacturer pfizer
has said a clinical trial of a pill to
treat covid19 shows that the drug is
highly effective the product is called
paxlavid and it's reported to have
achieved an 89 reduction in the risk of
hospitalization or death among adult
patients who are at high risk of
progressing to severe illness let's find
out more from our health correspondent
jim reed so how significant is this well
you think about last year jane there
were a rafter kind of companies talking
about the effectiveness of vaccines so
this year we've moved on to talk about
treatments instead so these are
treatments given to people who are at
high risk of catching the catching and
then going on to develop serious disease
so pills taken at home after you've
tested positive pfizer the second big
drug company to report clinical trial
results today and as she said again
really encouraging so 89 reduction in
the risk of needing hospital treatment
or of dying if you took this pill
compare with a group who were given a
dummy pill or placebo now it's still
early days this treatment is still going
to need approval by the regulators but
the uk authorities have already ordered
250 000 courses of this treatment and
another half a million courses of a
different treatment made by the company
merck that was approved earlier this
week by regulators the downside i should
mention is that these treatments do need
to be given very quickly after testing
positive for covid so it's going to be
up to the nhs this winter to roll these
out to people who need them as quickly
as possible for them to have much of an
effect
